title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A fable about following your dream, this story has inspired millions worldwide to live their best lives.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones by making tiny changes.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A critically acclaimed book that explores the history of the human species from the Stone Age to the present day.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic of modern American literature, this novel deals with the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance by 'Big Brother'.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: Timeless lessons on wealth, greed, and happiness through a series of short stories exploring the strange ways people think about money.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream, set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, near New York City.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel and children's book that follows the quest of home-loving Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about teenage angst and alienation, narrated by the cynical and disillusioned Holden Caulfield.

title: Gunaho Ka Devta
author: Dharamvir Bharati
description: An immortal love story that explores the complexities of relationships and societal norms in India.

title: Raag Darbari
author: Shrilal Shukla
description: A satirical Hindi novel that exposes the helplessness of an intellectual in a society dominated by a corrupt and decaying system.

title: Nirmala
author: Munshi Premchand
description: A poignant story about a young girl married to a man much older than her, highlighting the evils of the dowry system.

title: Apsara
author: Suryakant Tripathi 'Nirala'
description: A novel exploring the life and struggles of a woman in early 20th-century Indian society.

title: Saraswatichandra
author: Govardhanram Tripathi
description: A monumental classic of Gujarati literature, this novel is a saga of love, sacrifice, and social reform in 19th-century Gujarat.

title: Manvi Ni Bhavai
author: Pannalal Patel
description: A powerful novel depicting the struggles of a rural community during a severe famine in Gujarat.

title: Satyana Prayogo
author: Mahatma Gandhi
description: The autobiography of Mahatma Gandhi, detailing his experiments with truth and his journey of self-discovery.

title: Divya Chakshu
author: Ramanlal V. Desai
description: A social novel that explores the themes of love, idealism, and societal change in pre-independence India.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A landmark science fiction novel set in the distant future amidst a feudal interstellar society.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A shocking psychological thriller of a woman's act of violence against her husband—and of the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A heartbreaking coming-of-age story and a surprising tale of possible murder. Owens reminds us that we are forever shaped by the children we once were.

title: Godan
author: Munshi Premchand
description: Considered one of the greatest Hindi novels, it revolves around the socio-economic deprivation as well as the exploitation of the village poor.

title: Chandrakanta
author: Devaki Nandan Khatri
description: An epic fantasy novel that was the first work of modern Hindi literature, filled with magic, adventure, and romance.

title: Agnipankh
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
description: The Gujarati translation of 'Wings of Fire', the autobiography of the Missile Man of India, Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam.

title: Amrita
author: Raghuveer Chaudhari
description: A Jnanpith award-winning novel that explores existentialism and the complexities of human relationships.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The intimate, powerful, and inspiring memoir by the former First Lady of the United States.

title: Ikigai
author: Héctor García & Francesc Miralles
description: The Japanese secret to a long and happy life, this book helps you find your own ikigai (a reason to jump out of bed in the morning).
